---
title: Enabling Testnet in MiniPay
description: A guide to enable developer mode and testnet in MiniPay.
---
import ColoredText from '/src/components/ColoredText';

## Enabling Testnet in MiniPay

---

1. Tap the <ColoredText>profile icon</ColoredText> to open up the settings menu.

<img
  src={"/img/build/build-on-minipay/enabling-testnet/2.png"}
  style={{ width: 250 }}
  alt="Open MiniPay dApp store"
/>

2. Tap on the <ColoredText>"About"</ColoredText> option to get to the about screen.

<img
  src={"/img/build/build-on-minipay/enabling-testnet/3.png"}
  style={{ width: 250 }}
  alt="Open MiniPay dApp store"
/>

3. Tap on the <ColoredText>"Version"</ColoredText> number until you see the message that you have <ColoredText>enabled developer mode</ColoredText>.

<img
  src={"/img/build/build-on-minipay/enabling-testnet/4.png"}
  style={{ width: 250 }}
  alt="Open MiniPay dApp store"
/>

4. If you go back to the settings menu now, you will see an additional option of <ColoredText>"Developer Settings"</ColoredText> tap on it.

<img
  src={"/img/build/build-on-minipay/enabling-testnet/5.png"}
  style={{ width: 250 }}
  alt="Open MiniPay dApp store"
/>

5. Now you will see the <ColoredText>option to enable testnet</ColoredText>!

<img
  src={"/img/build/build-on-minipay/enabling-testnet/6.png"}
  style={{ width: 250 }}
  alt="Open MiniPay dApp store"
/>
